title: Image Analysis Scientist - CompBio
description:
As long as the ad is visible, the position is still open! You can find the job description and application details at www.voxlbio.com/careers.
  
About the job
  
Are you passionate and eager to contribute to cutting-edge biotech research? Join our dynamic and innovative startup as a part of our research and development team in Stockholm, Sweden where you’ll play a vital role in developing groundbreaking molecular tools and advancing Spatial Biology research. We are currently a small team with big ambitions, if you are interested or have any questions, don’t hesitate to reach out.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Define strategies for computational and software solutions needed for the new technology in development
  
Develop and implement efficient algorithms and pipelines for fluorescence microscopy image analysis
  
Actively seek feedback internally and externally, and explore options to bring most value to users
  
Collaborate closely with lab scientists and build streamlined analysis solutions
  
Actively participate in R&D activities and present findings in team meetings.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Masters with relevant industry experience, Ph.D / Postdoctoral in Bioinformatics, Computer Vision, Computational Biology, Computer Science, or a related field.
  
Prior experience with image analysis and visualization.
  
Familiarity with spatial omics technologies, datasets and viewers is strongly preferred.
  
Knowledge about machine learning and its application in object segmentation.
  
Ability to critically analyze complex data and communicate results to a multidisciplinary team.
  
Strong programming skills and good coding practices. Ability to write high-quality production code.
  
Familiarity with workflow management. Experience with developing and deploying pipelines and/or packages is a plus.
  
Familiarity with cloud computing.
  
Attention to detail, excellent organizational skill and ability to learn in a fast-paced environment.
  
Up to date with the Spatial Biology field and/or computational biology field is strongly preferred.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

An opportunity to work in a collaborative and entrepreneurial environment at the forefront of biotech innovation.
  
Hands-on training and mentorship from experienced scientists.
  
Exposure to an exciting field interfacing Spatial Biology and AI, and opportunity to make substantial contributions with novel solutions.
  
  

If you’re excited about contributing to cutting-edge research and growing with a pioneering biotech startup, we’d love to hear from you!
  
  

**How to Apply:**  

Send your CV and a brief cover letter to info@voxlbio.com. Please include "Image Analysis Scientist Application" in the subject line.
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Lead and Strengthen Security at BRP Group as our Cyber Security Manager!
description:
Are you an experienced IT security professional looking for your next challenge? BRP Group is searching for a Cyber Security Manager to take full ownership of cybersecurity across our entire organization. In this key role, you will oversee both IT security (ITSec) and application security (AppSec), ensuring strong protection across all aspects of our business.
  
About BRP Systems
  
At BRP Systems, we are proud to be the Nordic leader in digital solutions for the fitness and wellness industry. Since 2004, we’ve grown into a dynamic company with around 120 employees across four countries. Our software empowers over 2,700 fitness centers in ten countries, serving more than 3.5 million users every day. If you've ever booked a spin class, renewed a gym membership, or checked into a fitness center, chances are you’ve already used our products!
  
The role & key responsibilities
  
As the corporate IT Security Lead, you will drive and enforce security policies, ensure compliance, and establish governance and best practices. You will also collaborate with IT Operations across our locations. Your responsibilities will include:
  
**Application Security:** Ensure secure development processes, conduct security assessments, and maintain compliance.
  
**Secure Development Lifecycle (SDLC):** Work closely with product teams to enhance in-product security, perform assessments, and follow up on security measures.
  
**Cloud Operations Security:** Secure our SaaS infrastructure and ensure compliance with security best practices.
  
**Compliance Leadership:** Lead security-related efforts for ISO 27001, GDPR, PCI-DSS, and other key regulations.
  
**Stakeholder Engagement:** Represent BRP in security discussions with customers, partners, and leadership.
  
**Budget & Reporting:** Manage security budgets, track costs, and provide security reports to senior leadership.
  
  

Who We're Looking For
  
We are looking for a proactive leader who can drive and implement security initiatives. You might already be in a leadership role in cybersecurity, or this could be your next career step. The most important thing is your passion for both the strategic and hands-on aspects of cybersecurity.
  
  

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**  

Strong expertise in both IT security and application security.
  
Experience with security frameworks and standards such as CIS, ISO 27001, OWASP, and secure software development processes.
  
Hands-on experience implementing security measures is a strong plus.
  
Excellent communication skills—you can explain security concepts clearly to executives, developers, and IT teams.
  
Familiarity with network security, endpoint security, and AppSec concepts (e.g., OWASP, SAST, DAST).
  
  

Ready to Join Us?
  
If you're a cybersecurity professional eager to lead security efforts in a fast-growing, dynamic company, we’d love to hear from you! Send your application to hr@brpsystems.se today.

title: Legal Counsel to Spiideo
description:
Spiideo is a global leader in automated, cloud-based solutions for sports video analysis and streaming, headquartered in the heart of Malmö. Our customers are sport clubs, leagues and media companies all over the globe. As part of our growth journey, we are now looking to strengthening our team at the Lilla Torg office in Malmö with a highly skilled Legal Counsel.
  
  

About the role
  
In the role of Legal Counsel, you will be supporting the organization with a wide range of legal matters, with a special focus on our customer contracts and product terms and conditions. In this newly established role, you will have the unique opportunity to shape its development and be part of establishing new routines and processes. You will be the first and sole inhouse Legal Counsel and work closely with both the product development organization as well as the sales and marketing teams. You will report to the CFO and work with colleagues and customers across the globe.
  
  

**The role includes the following key responsibilities:**  

* Provide legal advice on customer contracts, including redlining and negotiations;
* Develop and maintain a robust and competitive structure for our product terms and conditions and implement a platform to manage contracts, track versions, and ensure compliance;
* Ensure that all customer contracts are up-to-date and reflect the latest product developments;
* Work cross-functionally with Product and Commercial to ensure good and competitive legal solutions for new product releases; and
* Work closely with our CEO, CFO, external law firms and other stakeholders on company related legal matters.


**Location:** Spiideo´s office at Lilla Torg 1 in Malmö with a short walking distance from the train station.
  
  

**Remote status:** Office first (Hybrid, minimum 3 days in Malmö office per week).
  
What we are looking for
  
We are looking for a qualified lawyer with a Master of Laws (LL.M) and at least seven years of experience as an associate from a reputable law firm or as in-house counsel at a tech company. You have strong expertise in drafting and negotiating commercial contracts and more specifically, experience of working with SaaS agreements and products. You have a great ability to develop and implement legal structures and processes. You are used to working independently and have excellent language skills in English, both orally and in writing.
  
  

To succeed in this role, you need to enjoy working in a rapidly changing and dynamic environment. You are a business-driven person with a proactive attitude and an excellent negotiator with a solution-oriented mindset. You are comfortable making decisions, and capable of providing clear guidance to the organization. You are a humble and positive team player who appreciates working across different functions.
  
What we offer you
  
We offer a collaborative, supportive environment with opportunities for professional growth. You will have the chance to make an impact in a growing, international SaaS company and be part of a friendly and skilled multinational team with people from many different nationalities and backgrounds.
  
  

We believe that when the best people work together in an open environment, magic happens. Working at Spiideo should be rewarding, fun, and developing yet challenging.
  
About Spiideo
  
Spiideo provides innovative solutions for automating sports video production, video analysis and streaming of all levels of sports - all over the world. The powerful cloud-based camera system uses AI to automatically capture high-quality, panoramic footage, enabling the delivery of high-quality analysis and feedback without manual filming.
  
  

Spiideo works globally with all levels of sports- from elite to amateur and senior to youth. Thousands of organizations are currently using Spiideo, including teams in the Premier League, NHL and NBA, as well as national leagues such as Sweden´s Allsvenskan.
  
  

Founded in Malmö in 2012, Spiideo has grown and scaled internationally, delivering products worldwide and with 100+ employees across 15 different countries. Alongside camera system development, customer success, sales and marketing, we have a complete product development organization in-house with high capacity in cloud, frontend, design, video and AI/ML.
  
Contact and Application
  
In this recruitment process, Spiideo is supported by Jurek Recruitment & Consulting. Please apply via www.jurek.se. We review new applications continuously. Kindly note that we do not accept applications by email.
  
  

For any questions, please contact Recruitment Consultant Linn Marthinussen by phone 076-002 69 41, or by email at linn.marthinussen@jurek.se

title: Delivery Lead - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
Tietoevry Care Delivery Lead – key role and person to deliver and develop our customer partnership, and our strategic agenda in Sweden
Health and Care market driven by a global digital transformation
The Health & Care sector is undergoing a profound digital transformation that includes investments across the entire care system to unleash the potential of data driven decisions, connecting all stakeholders, from citizens and patients to specialist care providers.
There is an immense need for enhanced digital capabilities in the Health & Care sector – and software businesses like Tietoevry Care have an enormous opportunity to contribute to improved health and care, while at the same time, nurturing substantial business growth.
Tietoevry Care – Nordic market leading health & care software company
We are a market leading clinical software provider in the Nordics. Our software products range from laboratory systems, electronic medical records, clinical specialty systems to welfare systems for elderly and family care, as well as data and analytics. With our +1600 experienced colleagues, Tietoevry Care has a very strong and unique market position and capabilities across the Nordics.  

Tietoevry Care partners with our customers to modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with our modular, open, and interoperable software. We are striving at simplifying everyday life for patients and personnel, and providing the tools required to transition towards increased self-and preventive care and lower cost-of-care settings, while placing citizens and patients at the center of our software solutions.
Tietoevry Care Data Driven Care – business/product organization
Data Driven Care is a newly founded growth driving business unit of Tietoevry Care, focusing on software products that connect care and turn care data into actionable insights. Our data and AI-driven solutions address these critical business challenges by offering the tools needed to unlock deeper insights from growing data volumes. With years of experience driving AI innovation in health and social care, we understand the vital role technology plays in transforming service delivery. The Data Driven Care portfolio includes Lifecare Data Platform, Lifecare Open Platform and Lifecare Resource Optimization.  

About the role as Delivery Lead
You will have a key role in the Data Driven Care business, with the overall responsibility of all implementation projects in Sweden ensuring customer satisfaction, contract fulfilment while achieving financial targets.
Among your focus responsibilities and activities are, to* Ensuring customer satisfaction, contract fulfilment and achieve financial targets for all implementation project within the Data Driven Care product portfolio in Sweden
* Develop Evolve, our implementation project capabilities in Sweden to continuously improve its performance in terms of e.g. customer satisfaction, contract fulfilment and financial performance
* Expand our implementation and delivery capabilities and team in the Swedish market in line with our business growth
* For key projects, act as the project manager and, for project with dedicated project manager, act as project owner to ensure agreed results in the implementation project
* Leadership, coaching and development of all Project Managers of Data Driven Care implementation projects in Sweden
* Utilize global and local capacity, partner eco-systems and subcontractors to optimize profitability and ensure top quality of the delivery.
* Ensure the right guidance for the customer and be seen as a trusted advisor and partner
* Understand and identify customers’ present and future needs and feedback to sales and product management
* Identification of organic growth opportunities within portfolio, and work with Customer Client Directors to progress and execute such opportunities

Ideally you possess the following competences and abilities:* Experience from leading large and complex value driven sales and deliveries in software, IT systems and projects
* Strong experience and knowledge about best-in-class implementation methodology from leading consulting firm or corresponding experience
* Clearly takes the role as strategic advisor and peer to c-level, and below
* Strong presenter and creator of complex value propositions orally and in written
* Proficient oral and written communication skills and effective stakeholder management skills
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish, and you speak proficient business English

It would be great if you also had experience from one or more of below areas:* Business development or strategic IT position at large healthcare provider or at municipality within the Social Care area
* Delivery experience from supplier of complex digital solutions and software to Health and/or Social Care
* Senior management consulting experience for healthcare market
* …..or, the above within relevant firms and to relevant customers providing a good base for our business

What's in it for you?
In Tietoevry Care Data Driven Care, you will have extensive opportunities for personal growth and building leading and relevant experience, based on our ambitious growth and expansion targets for the coming years, and that you will enter a company at the heart of one off the globally most interesting markets. Adding to this you will also personally be involved in the development of a sector of the uttermost importance for your fellow citizens and friends.
In our team we are working closely with and helping each other, and striving to have a creative, open and fun work together – while striving to deliver strong value for our customers and results for our company.
Could you be our new colleague?
We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager and Head of Operational Suite
Magnus Åslund: magnus.aslund@tietoevry.com *We perform background checks on all final candidates.**Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
About Tietoevry
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
#LI-AS5
#LI-Hybrid
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. title: Content Creator till Walley
description:
*Brinner du för kreativt innehåll och starka berättelser? Har du en skarp blick för visuell kommunikation och en teknisk skicklighet inom digitalt skapande? Just nu söker vi på Walley en kollega till vårt Brand and Marketing team. Hos oss får du en nyckelroll i teamet och får arbeta med ett varumärke som står inför en enormt spännande framtid.*  

  

**OM ROLLEN**  

Som Content Creator på Walley blir du en nyckelspelare i att forma vårt varumärkes visuella och digitala uttryck. Du kommer att skapa engagerande innehåll i olika format – rörligt, motion och still – med fokus på storytelling och kreativa koncept.
  

  

**OM DIG**

 **Vi söker dig som har:**  

  



* **Minst 3 års erfarenhet av innehållsproduktion** – både rörligt och stillbild, inklusive motion design.
* **Tekniska färdigheter inom Adob****e Creative Cloud** – Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop eller andra redigeringsprogram som CapCut eller Final Cut Pro.

Det är meriterande om du dessutom har kunskap i Figma/FigJam - för att skapa och samarbeta kring designidéer.


För att trivas i den här rollen bör du också ha en känsla för storytelling och kommunikation – du kan utveckla kreativa idéer och skapa innehåll som berör och engagerar. Med ett strategiskt tänk och förmågan att lyfta blicken driver du varumärket framåt och skapar värde för organisationen. Du är kreativ, initiativrik och arbetar självständigt med högt engagemang för att leverera innehåll som gör skillnad.

 **OM WALLEY**  

Walley är en strategisk partner inom betallösningar för medelstora och stora e-handlare samt butiker i Norden. Genom att erbjuda flexibla och kundvänliga betalsätt bidrar vi till att förbättra kundupplevelsen och skapa tillväxtmöjligheter för handlare.


Framåt står Walley inför en spännande tillväxtresa i en snabbrörlig bransch. Vi är ett passionerat team som arbetar hårt och ser till att ha roligt på vägen. Vi är en del av team Walley inkluderat produkt, sälj, merchants service etc och har alltid ett affärsdrivet mindset. I alla beslut vi tar ser vi till att bidra till Walleys övergripande affärsmål.  



  

**OM NORION BANK GROUP**  

Norion Bank Group är en affärsnära nordisk finansieringsbank. Genom koncernens varumärken Norion Bank, Walley och Collector erbjuds kundanpassade finansieringstjänster som möter distinkta kundbehov inom tre kundsegment: medelstora företag och fastighetsbolag, handlare och privatpersoner. Som specialist på finansieringslösningar är Norion Bank Group ett ledande komplement till traditionella storbanker, med visionen att vara den främsta nordiska finansieringsbanken inom de utvalda segmenten.


Norion Banks erbjudande omfattar företags- och fastighetskrediter samt factoring för medelstora företag och fastighetsbolag. Genom varumärket Walley erbjuds flexibla betal- och checkoutlösningar till handlare och privatpersoner. Varumärket Collector tillhandahåller privatlån och kreditkort till privatpersoner samt sparkonton för privatpersoner och företag. Norion Bank Group (tidigare Collector Bank) grundades 1999 och har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Oslo och Helsingfors. Verksamheten bedrivs genom Norion Bank AB (publ) som är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm.

 **NORION BANKS ERBJUDANDE TILL DIG**  

För oss är det självklart att varje individs utveckling värdesätts högt vilket innebär ett stort fokus på självledarskap och kompetensutveckling. Gemenskap, innovation och modern arbetsmetodik är saker som kännetecknar Norion Bank Group. Vi erbjuder dig helt enkelt en organisation med snabba beslutsvägar, stor öppenhet och mycket energi.


Våra värdeord Affärsmässighet, Engagemang och Omtanke genomsyrar allt vi gör och som medarbetare hos oss blir du en del av vår starka företagskultur. Vi erbjuder dig ett spännande bolag med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter, löpande kompetensutveckling och gemensamma aktiviteter på och utanför arbetsplatsen.

**Vi undanber oss kontakt med annonsörer, rekry****teringsbolag samt konsultbolag i rekryteringen.**

 **INTRESSERAD?**


Låter detta som något för dig? Skicka in din ansökan senast den **9 mars** och bli en del av vårt team! Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.


För frågor kring teamet och rollen, kontakta gärna Sofia Lundh, Head of Brand & Marketing Walley på sofia.lundh@walley.se


För frågor om oss som arbetsgivare eller rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta gärna Celie Weinhöfer, HRBP på celie.weinhofer@norionbank.se

title: Senior Cloud & FinOps Engineer
description:
- **Är du en duktig molningenjör med passion för både tekniska lösningar och kostnadsoptimering? Vill du arbeta i skärningspunkten mellan molntjänster och ekonomi? Då kan Devoteam M Cloud vara platsen för dig!**  

  

Är du redo att rulla upp skjortärmarna och delta i äventyret?
  

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  

  

**Devoteam** är ett ledande internationellt konsultföretag som arbetar med digitala transformationer. Vi har över 10 000 kollegor i 20 länder.
  

  

Vi på **Devoteam M Cloud** är specialiserade på Microsoft Azure och blev bland annat utsedda till Partner of the Year (Norge) av Microsoft 2023. Vi söker nu fler duktiga kollegor som vill vara med och skapa fantastiska molnresor för våra kunder. Hos oss möter du en miljö som inte bara handlar om teknisk innovation, utan också om att ha roligt på jobbet! Våra medarbetare brinner för att leverera de bästa lösningarna inom Azure, optimering och modernisering.

  
**Ansvar**

* Automatisera molntjänster och kostnadsoptimering: Skapa säkra och skalbara lösningar som ger fullständig insyn i kostnaderna med verktyg som PowerBI och Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Spela en nyckelroll i kundens FinOps-resa: Du kommer att hjälpa våra kunder att förstå och förbättra sina molnkostnader, vilket säkerställer att deras investeringar ger maximalt värde
* Arbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team: Tillsammans med kunden, våra tekniker och utvecklare kommer du att leverera holistiska, smarta lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.

  
**Kvalifikationer**

* Praktisk erfarenhet av att jobba med Infrastruktur som kod (IaC)
* Minst 3 års praktisk erfarenhet med molntjänster (Azure, AWS og Google Cloud)
* Du har gedigen erfarenhet av att skapa intuitiva PowerBI-instrumentpaneler som ger kunderna full insikt i deras kostnadslandskap.
Du är en problemlösare som arbetar bra med både tekniska och ekonomiska intressenter.  
* 

  

**Personliga egenskaper**

* Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och förmåga att se både helheten och detaljerna
* Du är lösningsorienterad och har en proaktiv inställning till problemlösning
* Stark förmåga att samarbeta, samtidigt som du tycker om att arbeta självständigt
* Du är nyfiken på ny teknik och vill ständigt utveckla din kompetens

  
- **Vi erbjuder:**


	* Möjligheten att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö med spännande kunder och projekt
	* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och utvecklingsmöjligheter inom både teknik och karriär
	* En professionell miljö där kunskapsdelning och kontinuerligt lärande är en del av kulturen
	* Tillgång till de senaste tekniska verktygen och plattformarna för att effektivt lösa komplexa utmaningarHos oss får du möjlighet att använda din expertis för att bygga framtidens
  

dataplattformar, samtidigt som du arbetar nära innovativa projekt som skapar mätbara
  

resultat. Vi söker en person som är redo för nya utmaningar och som vill utvecklas vidare i en spännande och framtidsorienterad miljö.
  

**Är det här du? Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: (Associate) IT Monitoring Engineer – based in Luxembourg
description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for
 **Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Operations & Services Desk Division (OSDK), Monitoring, Automation & Orchestration Unit (MAO)** 
 at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) IT Monitoring Engineer\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark (Associate) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure


 Panel interviews are foreseen as from January 2025.
   

  

 Purpose
   

  

 Would you like to contribute to the Digitalisation strategy with your knowledge of the monitoring domain? In this role you will manage the daily operations (RUN) and delivery of the monitoring of infrastructure and business application technologies.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Monitoring, Automation and Orchestration Unit, which is responsible for providing IT services for monitoring, automation, and orchestration.
   

  

 You will collaborate with colleagues from across the EIB Group, including external consultants and suppliers of software and/or related services.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Contribute to the implementation of the EIB strategy for effective use of IT technology in the domain of monitoring systems
* Ensure that projects are managed and that solutions are designed and implemented in line with internal standards and procedures and that best practice, security recommendations and industry standards are respected
* Manage and coordinate all project phases and project teams (consultants) for the implementation of complex projects
* Develop and maintain dashboards, alerts, and reports to proactively identify and address potential issues.
* Collaborate closely with the IT Security Unit, keeping up-to-date on key vulnerabilities, risks and audit
* Leverage technology to automate manual tasks, and seek efficiency gains
* Drive problems and incidents resolution in coordination with the Incident and Problem Manager
* Maintain hardware and software in the latest levels of patching and supported versions
* Be responsible for framework contract management related to Monitoring scope (including license and subscription usage) in collaboration with the Head of Unit
* Manage the relationship with the managed service provider, ensuring service delivery aligns with agreed-upon SLAs and KPIs.
* Act as the primary point of contact for internal teams regarding monitoring services provided by the managed service provider.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or related disciplines
* At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in monitoring IT infrastructure or application, with exposure on application logs and/or application performance monitoring
* Experience in running daily operations as well as IT projects
* Proven experience of monitoring tools deployment, provisioning and configuration (e.g. Splunk, Dynatrace)
* Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) for automation.
* ITIL knowledge in Change, Release, Incident and Problem Management
* Previous exposure to Artificial Intelligence would be highly advantageous
* Experience in delivering Monitoring solution to cloud and hybrid environments would be an advantage
* Experience managing or working with Managed Service Providers (MSPs) is a significant advantage.
* Understanding of procurement and service contracts, including procuring software and services in a public sector environment would be an advantage
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Lead Solution Architect
description:
*Do you have 5+ years of experience in software development and a deep understanding of modern technologies? If you have hands-on expertise in Node.js, NestJS, AWS, MongoDB, and frontend/backend frameworks, along with excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English, you could be the perfect fit for this exciting opportunity! Keep reading!* 




  





**About the position** 




 We are looking for a Lead Solution Architect for our client, a sports booking app designed for Sports enthusiasts. The office is located in Norsborg, where the company embraces a hybrid work setup with mandatory in-office collaboration two days per week, ensuring a balance between flexibility and team synergy.
 



  





**Your daily tasks** 




 As a Lead Solution Architect, you will play a vital role in shaping the future of our clients products and systems. Working directly with the CTO, you will oversee the design of scalable solutions, contribute to the development process, and coordinate efforts across various teams to ensure the on-time delivery of top-tier, production-ready systems.
 



 Collaborating closely with developers, Technical Leads, and stakeholders, you will ensure that technical approaches align with business objectives. Your expertise will help maintain operational excellence, including occasionally stepping in to support system stability during critical moments.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**Solution Architecture:** 




 Design and deliver innovative, scalable, and secure solutions for our app and booking platform.
 



**Hands-On Development:** 




 Actively engage in coding, solving complex challenges, and prototyping new features or integrations.
 



**Team Coordination:** 




 Collaborate with offshore Technical Leads and developers across Mobile, Backend, and Frontend teams to ensure alignment, resolve dependencies, and deliver efficiently.
 



**Production Readiness:** 




 Oversee CI/CD pipelines, testing, and deployments to maintain system stability and ensure production reliability.
 



**Stakeholder Collaboration:** 




 Partner with the CTO and other business leaders to align technical initiatives with strategic goals.
 



**Mentorship and Best Practices:** 




 Mentor developers, promote best practices, and ensure architectural documentation is accessible and up-to-date.
 



**Your characteristics** 




 We are looking for a Lead Solution Architect with a strong background in software development and solution design. The ideal candidate will have over 5 years of experience in software development, showcasing exceptional programming skills. Beyond technical skills, excellent communication abilities in both Swedish and English are required to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. A proactive mindset and a passion for innovation will help you thrive in this dynamic role.
 



  





 Could this be the opportunity you’ve been waiting for? We look forward to reading your application!
 



  





**Qualifications:** 



* 5+ years of experience in software development, with strong programming skills
* 2+ years of experience in solution architecture, designing scalable and secure systems
* Expertise in Node.js, NestJS, AWS, MongoDB, and modern frontend (React.js)/backend frameworks
* Experience with monolithic and microservices architectures
* Expertise with CI/CD pipelines, system monitoring, and production reliability practices
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with a proactive mindset
* Strong communication skills for collaborating across teams and stakeholders
* Fluent in Swedish and English



  





**Meritorious:** 



* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field
* A passion for sports and technology, with an interest in shaping the future of sports matchmaking and club management
* An innovative thinker who thrives in a collaborative and fast-paced environment
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively



  





**Contract type and hours** 




 Full-time, direct employment with the client. Start as soon as possible.
 



  





**Application** 




 Please apply through our website at perido.se/lediga-jobb/. Simply click the “Apply” button in the job advertisement, fill in your details, and upload your CV. We recommend submitting your application as soon as possible, as the selection process is ongoing. Please note that some details about the assignment and/or client company may have been deliberately disclosed in the advertisement. If your profile matches what the client is looking for and you are contacted by a recruiter, you will receive all the information you need.
 



  





**About Perido** 




 Why is our company named Perido? The name comes from the Latin word
 *Peridoneus* 
 , which means ‘well-matched’. Perido is a consulting and recruitment company specializing in the white-collar sector, dedicated to helping you take the next step in your career. Our vision is to ensure that everyone thrives and feels engaged at work. We have grown steadily since our founding in 2003 and now have over 1,500 employees across the country, including around fifty internal staff at our headquarters in Stockholm and Gothenburg. As a Perido consultant, you’ll play a key role in our organization, growing alongside us while strengthening our clients’ businesses with your skills. Please visit our website www.perido.se for more information.

title: Uppsökande säljare inom IT-hårdvara med fokus på nya kunder
description:
Nu söker vi en driven nykundsäljare med erfarenhet inom IT-hårdvara som vill bli en del av Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Vi söker dig som har en förmåga att göra komplex IT enkel och som gillar att upprätthålla värdefulla kundrelationer. På Iver är lagandan stark och nu har du chansen att bli en del av vårt framgångsrika säljteam inom Iver. Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Ivers erbjuder bland annat en komplett livscykelhantering för datorer och mobila enheter – från logistik och asset management till återbruk och hållbar återvinning. Tjänsten erbjuder en komplett arbetsplats med konfigurerade och färdiginstallerade datorer och/eller mobila enheter med möjlighet att skräddarsy support, administration av applikationer, uppdateringar och policys. Det är en flexibel och skalbar lösning för våra kunder, som är enkel att skala upp och ner.
   

  

 Affären växer och vi satsar på att utveckla området inom Iver. Vi söker en engagerad och målinriktad säljare som brinner för att hitta nya affärsmöjligheter och skapa långsiktiga kundrelationer inom IT-hårdvara. Du kommer att ha en nyckelroll i att leda hela säljcykeln med allt från att identifiera affärsmöjligheter, kvalificering, utveckla lösningen, skriva offerter, prissättning, skapa presentationer för ledande befattningar, förhandla och stänga affärer.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Aktivt och uppsökande bearbeta nya kunder inom olika branscher och segment.
* Bygga och utveckla kundrelationer från första kontakt till långsiktiga samarbeten.
* Identifiera kunders behov av IT-hårdvara och presentera skräddarsydda lösningar som skapar värde och effektivitet.
* Leda presentationsmöten, demonstrationer och förhandlingar med potentiella kunder.
* Arbeta självständigt för att nå och överträffa individuella försäljningsmål.
* Samarbeta med vårt tekniska team för att säkerställa att våra lösningar möter kundernas krav och behov.
* Regelbundet rapportera och följa upp försäljningsaktivitet och resultat.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Iver - We empower our Nordic society. Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
   

  

**Din profil & Bakgrund?**
 För att lyckas i rollen hos oss tror vi att du har dokumenterad framgångsrik erfarenhet av uppsökande försäljning inom IT-branschen, gärna inom IT-hårdvara. Du brinner för att göra affärer genom personligt engagemang, innovativa lösningar och kompetens i framkant, med målet att vara en långsiktig och hållbar partner. I rollen kommer du att möta kunder och nyckelpersoner i ledande befattningar och behöver ha förmågan att snabbt bygga förtroende. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet och vill att du utvecklas tillsammans med oss, både som säljare och medarbetare för att bidra till arbetsglädje, vår tillväxt och ett bra kundbemötande.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Är van att skapa nya affärsmöjligheter genom proaktivt prospektering och kallringning.
* Har en god teknisk förståelse för IT-hårdvara och kan snabbt sätta dig in i kunders behov av produkter och relaterade lösningar.
* Är en självständig, målmedveten och resultatinriktad person som trivs med att jobba i en snabb och föränderlig miljö.
* Är van att arbeta med CRM-system och följa upp aktiviteter och resultat på ett strukturerat sätt.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska.
* B-körkort.


**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige och Norge. Denna tjänst utgår från vårt kontor i Solna men du kommer att bearbeta affären inom hela vår marknad.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-03-16. Du är välkommen att kontakta Henrik Olsson (henrik.olsson@iver.se) vid eventuella frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Office Coordinator
description:
**Who We Are** 

 Paligo is an industry-leading SaaS company in the field of Component Content Management Systems (CCMS). We empower global teams to create, manage, translate and publish technical documentation using our cloud-based platform. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies such as Amazon, Allianz, Mitsubishi, the European Commission, and Gong, our goal is to become the top solution in our industry.
 



 We are looking for exceptional individuals like YOU to take us to the next level!
 


**About the Role** 

 Do you thrive in a dynamic, international environment and love keeping things running smoothly? Paligo is looking for an
 **Office Coordinator** 
 (Part-time) to ensure that our office remains a welcoming, well-organized, and inspiring place to work. If you’re a structured, service-minded problem solver with an eye for detail and a passion for people, this could be the perfect role for you!
 


**Your Key Responsibilities** 
* Ensure the office is a well-functioning, inviting space for all employees.
* Keep the kitchen tidy and stocked with refreshments and snacks.
* Manage office supplies and coordinate with vendors.
* Welcome visitors and handle deliveries.
* Organize team activities and company events.
* Support the onboarding and offboarding of employees.
* Assist in coordinating business travel and conferences.
* Assist the Leadership Team.
* Handle budget follow-ups related to office expenses.






**About You** 





 We are looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced and international work environment. You are a highly organized multitasker with a keen eye for detail and a strong sense of ownership over your responsibilities.
 



 To succeed in this role, you should be a problem-solver who enjoys taking initiative and working independently.
   

 Furthermore, you bring:
 


* A positive, proactive, and can-do attitude.
* Strong organizational skills and an ability to multitask effectively.
* Fluency in both
 **Swedish and English.**
* Previous experience in administrative roles that require coordination and efficiency.
* A genuine passion for creating a great workplace environment for others.


**What We Offer** 

 At Paligo, we offer a collaborative and innovative SaaS environment where every team member plays a crucial role. This is a great opportunity to be part of a growing company where you’ll have a real impact on both people and processes.
 



 Are you ready to create an exceptional office experience with us?
 **We’d love to hear from you – apply today!**

title: Inside Sales Representative, Nordics
description:
**Welcome to the future of cloud networking and security!**
 Cato Networks is the first company to converge enterprise networking and security into one centralized and global service that is delivered by cloud. It is led by networking and security pioneer Shlomo Kramer (Check Point, Imperva) and early investor (Palo Alto Networks, Exabeem, Trusteer and more). Cato’s unique technology inspired a brand-new product category, later named “SASE” by Gartner and a market expected to reach $25 billion by 2027.
   

  

 This is your opportunity to get on the rocket ship and join a company that is building a cutting-edge enterprise network and secure cloud platform, and is on a fast track to becoming the worldwide market leader – don’t miss it!
   

  

 We're seeking experienced Inside Sales Representatives to join our exceptional team. Your critical role will drive revenue in our defined markets. Seize the chance to be a part of the company who invented and pioneered the revolution of SASE!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Own a designated region, driving new business and overseeing renewals.
* Manage a full sales cycle from prospecting new opportunities to closing mid-market deals and leading customer expansion on assigned accounts.
* Collaborate and strategize with internal stakeholders and channel partners to build and execute a GTM plan that focuses on pipeline creation, account strategy, and driving net-new business.
* Engage enterprise-level IT executives and evaluate their needs based on MEDDPICC sales methodology.
* Become a subject-matter expert in Cato’s offering and stay well informed on Cato’s competitive landscape.
* Demonstrate a high degree of flexibility, as this role will continue to evolve based on business demands.
* Report to AVP EMEA with regional forecasts, pipeline updates, and internal travel requirements.


**Requirements**
* 2+ years of full sales cycle experience, demonstrating successful ownership of territory and quota.
* Expertise with consultative sales approach in vendor technology sales, particularly SaaS, Cloud, and/or Security solution to mid-market organizations.
* Proven track record with hunting, qualifying, and surpassing sales targets.
* Deep understanding of GTM strategies and ability to execute strategies through effective lead generation and leveraging strategic partner relations.
* Skillful in building rapport and influencing executive-level and technical stakeholders through compelling presentations and negotiation styles.
* Commitment to driving issues and contracts to close, demonstrating persistence and a sense of urgency.
* Previous exposure to competitive, hyper-growth environments.
* Background or education in engineering considered advantageous.

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Service Delivery Director
description:
****Join Telavox as Service Delivery Director 🌎****
 Telavox is looking for a customer Service Delivery Director to oversee critical operator projects, ensuring successful delivery while driving innovation, efficiency, and quality in telecom and cloud communication solutions.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll drive initiatives that streamline project management, refine solution architecture, and optimize service delivery processes for excellent customer outcomes.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As the Service Delivery Director, you will align technical delivery with business objectives. You’ll lead major customer engagements, oversee complex projects, and ensure solutions are designed and delivered to meet the highest standards. In this role, you will also collaborate closely with sales teams, contributing to pre-sales efforts and enabling commercial management to ensure our solutions meet technical and business objectives. While the primary focus is hands-on project management, your efforts will shape a scalable and efficient delivery function, aligning with Telavox’s global ambitions in UCaaS and Telco solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead and manage projects by planning and delivering key Operator initiatives, ensuring timely execution within budget and scope.
* Optimize Service Delivery by developing scalable workflows and processes that drive efficient, high-quality customer service delivery.
* Collaborate on solutions by partnering with Solution Architects to design tailored, customer-centric architectures for telecom services.
* Strengthen client relationships by acting as the primary project interface for Operators, managing engagements to meet KPIs, and fostering long-term partnerships.


**About You**
 This role is ideal for a strategic and hands-on leader who thrives in dynamic environments and is motivated by the opportunity to shape scalable delivery functions aligned with Telavox’s global ambitions.
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced professional with a technical background and an ability to manage complex projects. You thrive at building relationships across technical, operational, and commercial dimensions while driving impactful results.
   

  

**Key Qualifications And Skills**
* With telecom expertise, you bring in-depth knowledge of VoIP, UCaaS, SIP, PBX systems, and cloud-based communication solutions, enabling you to manage modern telecom challenges effectively.
* Your project leadership skills are evident in your track record of successfully managing large-scale projects for Tier 1 Operators, consistently meeting or exceeding delivery KPIs.
* Leveraging your solution architecture expertise, you excel in designing scalable, secure, and reliable telecom solutions that align with customer needs.
* Focusing on customer engagement ensures you have strong experience managing client relationships and delivering exceptional outcomes that exceed expectations.


**We Like You To Have**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or a related field.
* Experience in telecom and software project delivery, particularly within the Operator domain.
* A strategic mindset combined with hands-on execution capabilities.


 At Telavox, we foster a culture of innovation and collaboration. Based in our Malmö or Stockholm office, you’ll be part of a fast-growing, inclusive team that values your expertise and contributions. This is your opportunity to make a real impact and advance your career with a company at the forefront of UCaaS and telecom solutions.
   

  

****Why Telavox? 💚****
 Since Telavox's journey started in 2002, we have strengthened our position as the leading forward-thinking communication platform for businesses. We offer Telephony, PBX, messaging, meetings, and contact centres in one simple platform. Unlike our competitors, we own our platform and develop everything ourselves in-house.
   

  

 Today, we are a fast-growing and profitable company with +1.9b in revenue and +500 Telavoxers in nine countries. We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive, supportive culture where everyone can thrive.
   

  

 By joining us, you will not only contribute to our technology but also be part of a company that values work-life balance, continuous learning, and community. Plus, you will enjoy our legendary company events, personal development opportunities, and much more 😀
   

  

**Are you interested in becoming part of Telavox? Apply now!**
 At Telavox, we don't focus on fitting in; we focus on making room for everyone.
   

  

 Join Telavox, where diversity fuels innovation. Apply now to join a team committed to creating a truly inclusive workplace.
   

  

 Do not miss out on this exciting opportunity to grow your career and make your mark on the future of telecom technology. Send your application our way, and let us explore what we can achieve together!
   

  

 For any questions, feel free to reach out to Talent Acquisition Partner Ami Faraguna at ann-marie.faraguna@telavox.com
   

  

**Due to the holiday season, responses to applications may be delayed. Our team will review all applications and get back to you after January 13th. Thank you for your patience, and happy holidays! 🎄**
**Learn more about what we do! ⬇️**
 Telavox develops world-leading communications platforms with solutions for smart and efficient telephony, PBX, chat and much more. Regardless of whether it involves an entrepreneur-driven startup or a giant among giants, Telavox contributes to making companies more transparent, efficient and accessible.

title: Senior Enterprise Architect, Asset & Wealth Management
description:
**Job ID: 24969**
**Digital Solutions, Wealth Management, Investments and Savings**
 Would you like to influence the future digital bank? We are now looking for an experienced Senior Enterprise Architect to lead architectural solution design within Asset & Wealth Management (AWM) for future offerings and digital channel solutions, that will realize Nordea’s Digital Strategy. We aim to exploit leading edge digital innovations to make Nordea more personal, convinient, relevant, and proactive.
   

  

 In Nordea, we’re harnessing the power of technology to reinvent the future of banking. A tech revolution is underway – and you can make an impact. Working with international teams in an inspiring working environment, you’ll have lots of opportunities to expand your skills and advance your career.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Welcome to the AWM Architecture team. We add value by architecting next generation digital solution, product and service offerings for Nordea customer regarding Savings and Investments. As an Enterprise Architect, you’ll play a valuable role in defining how our change initiatives can meet customer and business demands by providing easy to follow architecture designs and guidelines.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
* Work closely with primary stakeholders in AWM and across the Nordea Group, incl. subsidiaries like Nordea Asset Management and Nordea Life & Pension in the Nordic
* Adding knowledge and supporting the AWM Architecture team to improve
* Draw on existing architectures and technology standards to determine feasible options
* Help reducing the complexity at Nordea through reuse of solutions and components
* Drive design decisions for the the solution architecture and document the result
* Interact with build teams to ensure the architecture is communicated properly
* Interact with the wider architecture community to facilitate learning and maturation
* Work with systematic documentation in Architecture Tools


 You’ll join a dynamic and experienced international team. The role is based in Gdańsk; Gdynia; Helsinki; Stockholm; Warszawa.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:**
* Analytical in clarifying problems to be solved
* Innovative in coming up with solutions and architectures
* Influential in driving solution implementation
* A good team player
* Structured and systematic


**Your experience and background:**
* Driving solution architecture designs in banking or similar industries
* Demonstrated experience in strategic architecture
* Driving alignment and resolving conflicts across stakeholders like Product Owners, Legal, Developers, Operations etc.
* Contributing constructive feedback to fellow architecture community members and contributing to the maturation of the architecture practice
* 5-10 years of acting in the IT Architecture field


 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 20/02/2024. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Lina Gustafsson at lina.gustafsson@nordea.com
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**Only for candidateds in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf .
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Head of Integration Competence Center to Dometic
description:
*Our client, Dometic – a global leader in the mobile living industry, is expanding its Group IT function and is now looking for a Head of Integration Competence Center.* 




  





**About the position** 




 Dometic is a global market leader in the mobile living industry. Millions of people around the world use Dometic products in outdoor, residential, and professional applications. Dometic is on a journey of continuous growth – now looking for their next star – a Head of Integration Competence Center to Dometic Group IT.
 



  





**As Head of Integration Competence Center** 
 at Dometic, you will be responsible for translating business needs and requirements into capabilities and ways of working to support the manufacturing plants, distribution centers, and sales offices. You will play a critical role in ensuring seamless data flow, efficient application integration, and automation across the diverse business units. Your expertise will drive innovation, enhance operational efficiency, and enable data-driven decision-making. You will manage a small core team at Group HQ delivering support to Dometic Group and provide a competence center to the segment teams who will provide their own resources.
 



 You will be expected to foster a collaborative, continuous improvement, and customer first mindset throughout the organization as well as establishing partnerships throughout Dometic and with external partners, to ensure a high-quality result for Dometic and a positive experience for end-users. The position reports to the Global Head of Cloud & IT Operations and is located at the HQ in Stockholm, Solna Strand.
 



  





**Your main responsibilities** 



* Responsible for delivering cost-effective Integration capabilities for Dometic in accordance with IT strategy including overseeing the design, development, testing, and deployment of integrations.
* Ensure timely delivery of integration projects, meeting quality standards and business expectations.
* Develop and maintain the integration strategy.
* Design integrations based on business requirements and integration strategy.
* Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to define integration requirements and priorities.
* Develop training programs to enhance integration skills across teams.
* Ensure that operations and services meet the needs of the business, simplify/streamline processes, and create a culture of continuous improvement as related to integrations.
* Responsible for lifecycle management of solutions and services within Integration service domain.



  





**What does Dometic offer?** 




 You are offered an interesting role in a dynamic, fast-paced and global environment with great opportunities to grow and take on new challenges. The growth at Dometic is continuous – which gives you great possibilities to evolve with the company.
 



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




 A suitable background would be a minimum of 5 years’ experience from delivering integrations, preferably supporting manufacturing organizations – as well as the following qualifications and experiences:
 


* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
* Integration architect experience using Azure.
* Experience working with Dell Boomi is beneficial.
* Experience or certification in ITIL and/or Agile based environments or ways of working is also a plus.
* Fluent in English, speaking and writing, including the ability to explain technologies to business leaders and communicate business needs to technical teams.



  





**To be successful in this role, we believe that you possess the following skills, competencies & characteristics:** 



* You are a strong teamplayer with good collaboration skills and can bring a team together.
* You have a natural understanding of how systems interconnect.
* You can easily translate business requirements into IT deliveries.
* You can communicate with stakeholders at all levels.
* You dare to challenge and are results oriented.
* You are a self-starter with a high level of motivation and drive.
* You are a problem solver and a doer – you have the ability to see things from a high level perspective as well as executing at an operational level.
* Finally, Dometic is a fast paced and dynamic company – this is an environment you know that you thrive in!



  





**Dometic Core Values** 




 To thrive and succeed in this role, you understand the importance of Dometics core values – Together We build our future, We play to win, We embrace change and We walk the talk; these values reflect the heart and soul of Dometic and they define what it takes to work here and how we do things.
 



 Dometic operates with an Office First Policy with the possibility to work 1 day per week remotely. We see the social aspect of being in the office, meeting colleagues, having short coffee break interactions or a quick face to face meeting as key to success as we become more productive and fast paced in terms of problem solving, learning, cross functional collaboration and not the least in a way to have fun at work!
 



  





**Are you Dometics next star?** 
 Then we would love to see your application. In this recruitment, Dometic is collaborating with Ants Executive Search. Selection is being made on a running basis. If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact:
 



 Ludvig Nilsson, Executive Recruitment Consultant, at ludvig.nilsson@ants.se
 



 Nathalie Baker, Executive Recruitment Consultant, at nathalie.baker@ants.se
 



 In this recruitment, personality and logical test will be used as part of the process.

title: Senior Solution Engineer - SWE
description:
Senior Solution Engineer, Sweden
   

  

*This is your unique opportunity to take on a customer-facing engineering role where you will deliver and implement tactical communications systems and IT solutions. Are you on the outlook for a role where you can apply your broad technical skillset?*
**Truly international – proudly Danish**
 Systematic was established in 1985, and has since grown to more than 1100 people, working across three core business areas:
   

 Digitalisation, Healthcare & Defence. This means that every day, more than a million people worldwide use our solutions. Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish, and uniquely people centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters the most.
   

  

**Customer-facing engineering role**
 As Systematic in Sweden, are currently ramping up in our Defence business area, we are on the lookout for a Senior Solution Engineer. The role includes, to take on the leading role of delivering SitaWare and Iris suites for Defence customers, primarily in Sweden but can differ depending to the project.
   

  

 You will be working closely with multiple customers, rolling out a mission-critical system that creates value by simplifying decision-making, and where we need our solutions to work, when it matters the most. Your focus will be to ensure, that our products are installed and are operational while ensuring that our product suite, interacts accordingly with the support from the rest of the Systematic organization. Beyond providing technical support and advice both on-site and back office, your key tasks will include:
   

  

* Design, implement and support technical solutions
* Perform acceptance testing
* Conduct technical training for our customers – both in classroom environments and in workshop set-ups
* Provide first and second-level technical customer support on our solution


 Furthermore, you will be responsible for coordinating with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, subcontractors, consultants and colleagues at Systematic. Finally, you will stay up to date on the capabilities of Systematic products to ensure alignment of customer expectations to provide maximal value for the customers.
   

  

 Your place of work will be at our office in central Stockholm, Sweden, and you should expect some travel (usually 2-4 days at a time) servicing your customer sites in Europe depending on the project.
   

  

**Customer-centric with a broad toolbox**
 We hope that you can recognize yourself in the statement that, you are eager to contribute to a successful team while developing and applying your strong and wide-ranging technical skills to deliver value to the customers.
   

  

 Additionally, you bring some years of experience from a similar role combined with a technical educational background.
   

  

 We also expect you to be able to identify yourself in the following:
   

  

* a customer-centric mindset and preferably experience interacting and engaging with customers directly
* experience within one or more of the following areas:
   

 tactical communications systems, IT infrastructure, software and system testing and/or test management), software development
* experience with technical training
* a strong communicator with professional proficiency in both Swedish and English


 Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects.
   

  

**Never stop developing**
 At Systematic there is room to be professional and personal and we encourage our employees to be continue and share their knowledge across sites. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong. We invest in the further development and education of our Systemates. This is why we never stop developing.
   

  

**Start your development here**
 We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen, Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant.
   

  

 Get in touch
   

  

 Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen
   

  

 Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

title: Customer Solutions Architect
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services and Software Development
description:
**Är du nyfiken på hur BI och data kan göra konkret skillnad för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag? Konstrukt söker nu en Customer Solutions Architect med intresse för datadriven planering och innovation. I den här rollen får du använda din expertis för att bygga planeringslösningar för våra kunder och forma vår gemensamma utvecklingsresa.** 




  





**Om Konstrukt**




 Konstrukt är ett snabbväxande SaaS-bolag med kontor i både
 **Göteborg** 
 och
 **Stockholm** 
 . Vår produkt –
 **Konstrukt to.grow** 
 – hjälper företag att ta bort osäkerhet kring kassaflöde, avtal och beläggning, och i stället skapa
 **trygghet, kontroll och framåtblick** 
 . Med smarta integrationer mot bland annat Kleer, Fortnox, Qlik och Power BI bidrar vi till att fler personer i en organisation kan vara involverade i planeringsprocessen – utan att det skapar kaos.
 



  





 Vi har redan en spännande kundbas med företag som
 **Espresso House** 
 ,
 **First Camp** 
 ,
 **Polestar** 
 ,
 **Fortnox** 
 ,
 **Beatly** 
 och
 **Telia Cygate** 
 , men vår resa har bara börjat. Vår drivkraft är att skapa
 **innovativa, användarvänliga lösningar** 
 som verkligen förändrar arbetssättet kring verksamhetsstyrning.
 



  





**Teamet**




 Hos Konstrukt möts du av ett
 **entreprenöriellt, omtänksamt** 
 team som gillar att testa nya idéer och hitta kreativa vägar framåt. Vi är i dagsläget 9 personer med en gedigen bakgrund inom business intelligence, systemutveckling och verksamhetsanalys. Vi tror på
 **frihet under ansvar** 
 och värdesätter en arbetsmiljö där alla röster hörs och får utrymme.
 



  





**Customer Success-teamet** 
 är placerat i både Göteborg och Stockholm. Tillsammans skapar vi tekniska lösningar som gör stor skillnad för våra kunder – och vi vill gärna bli fler som delar vår passion för data och verksamhetsutveckling.
 



  





**Om rollen**




 Som
 **Customer Solutions Architect** 
 blir du en nyckelspelare i våra kundprojekt och hjälper företag att bygga
 **skräddarsydda planeringslösningar** 
 i vår plattform. Dina insikter och din förmåga att
 **översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar** 
 gör att kunderna kan arbeta mer effektivt och fatta smartare beslut.
 



  





**Exempel på a rbetsuppgifter:** 



* **Teknisk uppsättning & integrationer** 
 : Koppla ihop kundens befintliga system och datakällor med Konstrukt så att datan flödar smidigt.
* **Implementering & leverans:** 
 Genomför teknisk implementation och se till att kunden får en lösning som är helt anpassad efter deras unika behov.
* **Datamodellering & planeringslösningar:** 
 Bygg och konfigurera modeller i Konstrukt som underlättar beslutsfattande och planering.
* **Rådgivning & workshops:** 
 Håll i workshops, ge proaktiva förslag och coacha kunden i hur de kan utnyttja data ännu bättre.
* **Produktutveckling & feedback:** 
 Dela med dig av lärdomar och feedback till vårt produktteam så att vi kan fortsätta utveckla och förbättra Konstrukt.



  





**Din profil**




 Vi tror att du:
 


* Gillar att
 **samarbeta och hjälpa andra** 
 – du är prestigelös och stöttar där det behövs.
* Har
 **god förståelse för BI, data engineering och/eller beslutsstödsverktyg** 
 .
* Är
 **analytisk och affärsorienterad** 
 – du ser både detaljerna och helheten i kundens verksamhet.
* Trivs med att bygga
 **långsiktiga relationer** 
 och har lätt för att kommunicera med olika typer av intressenter.
* Är
 **initiativrik och självgående** 
 – i en snabbt växande miljö tar du gärna egna initiativ för att driva projekt framåt och identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter hos kunderna.
* Behärskar
 **svenska och engelska** 
 flytande, i tal och skrift.



  





*Vi värdesätter mångfald och olika erfarenheter! Om du inte uppfyller precis alla krav, men ändå tror att du skulle passa in hos oss, uppmuntrar vi dig att söka!* 




  





**Kvalifikationer vi söker**



* **3+ års erfarenhet** 
 av BI, data eller närliggande områden – gärna i en konsultroll eller kundnära funktion.
* **Teknisk kompetens** 
 inom databashantering, datamodellering och/eller beslutsstödsverktyg.
* **Kundfokus** 
 – du vill förstå kundens utmaningar på djupet och vara en pålitlig rådgivare.
* **Entreprenörsanda** 
 – du trivs när det är mycket på gång och gillar att vara med och sätta strukturer och processer i takt med att vi växer.
* **Flytande i svenska och engelska -** 
 både i tal och skrift.



  





**Vad vi erbjuder**



* **Konkurrenskraftig lön:** 
 Baserad på din erfarenhet och kompetens.
* **Generös pensionsavsättning enligt ITP1:** 
 Vi vill att du känner ekonomisk trygghet även i framtiden.
* **30 dagars betald semester:** 
 Vi värnar om balans mellan arbete och fritid.
* **Sjukförsäkring:** 
 Extra trygghet om du skulle bli sjuk.
* **En roll som ger stor påverkan och variation:** 
 Du får arbeta med både tekniska utmaningar och strategiska diskussioner.
* **En trivsam, inkluderande kultur:** 
 Vi tror på olikheternas styrka och strävar efter en arbetsmiljö där alla kan växa.



  





**Ansökan**




 Låter det spännande? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt!
 



  





 Har du frågor om rollen eller processen, kontakta
 **Fredrik Johansson** 
 på Fredrik@hicareer.com.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och kanske välkomna dig som vår nästa kollega på
 **Konstrukt** 
 !
